words: Susie là bác.sĩ và cô.ấy cũng là giáo.viên
glosses: Susie COP doctor and 3SG also COP teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.
comment: without “cũng” it sounds like the pronoun refers to someone else

words: Susie là bác.sĩ, cô.ấy cũng là giáo.viên
glosses: Susie COP doctor, 3SG also COP teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor; she is a teacher.
comment: that’s ok with “cũng”

words: Paul vừa xem ti.vi vừa là áo
glosses: Paul SIMUL watch TV SIMUL iron shirt
translation: Paul is watching TV and he is ironing his shirts.

words: Paul đang xem ti.vi, anh.ấy đang là áo
glosses: Paul PROG watch TV, 3SG PROG iron shirt
translation: Paul is watching TV; he is ironing his shirts.
comment: again, this gets a disjoint subjects interpretation

words: Susie là bác.sĩ nhưng cô.ấy nghèo
glosses: Susie COP doctor but 3SG poor
translation: Susie is a doctor but she is poor.

words: Jen mua kem nhưng cô.ấy lại mua cho một người.lạ
glosses: Jen buy ice.cream but 3sg PRT buy PREP INDEF stranger
translation: Jen bought ice cream, but she bought it for a stranger.
comment: lại expresses something like surprisal / contrary to expectation

words: Paul không phải là bác.sĩ mà là nhân.viên lễ.tân
glosses: Paul NEG true COP doctor but COP worker reception
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.
comment: phải is also a modal (usually deontic necessity)

words: Jen không mua kem mà mua sô.cô.la
glosses: Jen NEG buy ice.cream but buy chocolate
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream but she bought chocolate.

words: Câu trả.lời cho câu hỏi trên là A hoặc câu trả.lời cho câu hỏi trên là B
glosses: CLF answer for CLF question PRP COP A or CLF answer for CLF question PRP COP B
translation: (Either) the answer to the question is A or the answer to the question is B.
comment: just NP disjunction would be more natural

words: Paul là bác.sĩ hoặc John là bác.sĩ
glosses: Paul COP doctor or John COP doctor
translation: Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.

words: tôi để điện.thoại ở chỗ làm hoặc tôi đánh.rơi nó trên đường .về.nhà
glosses: 1SG leave phone PRP place work or 1SG drop it PRP way.home
translation: I left my phone at work or I dropped it on my way home.

words: Hoặc tôi để điện.thoại ở chỗ làm hoặc tôi đánh.rơi nó trên đường .về.nhà
glosses: Or 1SG leave phone PRP place work or 1SG drop it PRP way.home
translation: I left my phone at work or I dropped it on my way home.

words: John có thể là bác.sĩ hoặc John có thể là nhà.văn
glosses: John EXIS ABIL COP doctor or John EXIS ABIL COP writer
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer.

words: Hoặc John là bác.sĩ hoặc John là nhà.văn
glosses: Or John COP doctor or John COP writer
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer.
comment: doubling hoặc increases uncertainty

full_form: có thể … hoặc cũng … có thể
words: John có thể là bác.sĩ hoặc cũng có thể là nhà.văn
glosses: John EXIS ABIL COP doctor or also EXIS ABIL COP writer
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer (maybe both).
comment: Hoặc in the part in brackets preferred

words: Bạn để điện.thoại ở chỗ làm hay bạn để trên xe buýt?
glosses: You leave phone PRP place work or you leave PRP CLF bus?
translation: Did you leave your phone at work or did you leave it on the bus?

words: Tiệm A bán hiệu này hay tiệm B bán hiệu này?
glosses: Shop A sell brand this or shop B sell brand this?
translation: Would Shop A sell this brand or would Shop B sell this brand?

words: Paul không phải là bác.sĩ cũng không phải là y.tá
glosses: Paul NEG true COP doctor also NEG true COP nurse
translation: Paul is neither a doctor nor is he a nurse.

words: Mike không mua kem cũng không đưa kem cho em.gái
glosses: Mike NEG buy ice.cream also NEG give i.c. for little.sister
translation: Mike didn’t buy ice cream nor did he give it to his sister.

words: Paul có thể ăn bánh cupcake hoặc cũng có thể ăn bánh quy
glosses: Paul EXIS ABL eat CLF cupcake or also EXIS ABL eat CLF cookie
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or he can eat a cookie.

words: Susie không phải là bác.sĩ hay vận.động.viên điền.kinh
glosses: Susie NEG true COP doctor or athlete track
translation: Susie isn’t a doctor or a runner.

words: Susie là bác.sĩ, cô.ấy là giáo.viên
glosses: Susie COP doctor, 3SG COP teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor; she is a teacher.
comment: this is good

words: Susie là bác.sĩ cô.ấy cũng là giáo.viên
glosses: Susie COP doctor 3SG also COP teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor; she is a teacher.

words: Susie có thể là bác.sĩ và cô.ấy cũng có thể là giáo.viên
glosses: Susie EXIS ABIL COP doctor and 3SG also EXIS ABIL COP teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor or she is a teacher.
comment: corrected from: # Susie là bác.sĩ và cô.ấy cũng là giáo.viên

words: Susie có thể là bác sĩ, hoặc có thể là giáo viên, hoặc vừa là bác sĩ vừa là giáo viên
glosses: Susie EXIS ABIL COP doctor, or EXIS ABIL COP teacher, or SIMUL COP doctor SIMUL COP teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor or she is a teacher (maybe both).
comment: corrected from: # Susie là bác.sĩ và cô.ấy cũng là giáo.viên

words: Paul có thể là vừa xem ti.vi vừa là áo
glosses: Paul EXIS ABIL COP SIMUL watch TV SIMUL iron shirt
translation: Paul is watching TV, he is ironing his shirts.
comment: ok with a modal

words: Paul chắc là vừa xem ti.vi vừa là áo
glosses: Paul SURELY COP SIMUL watch TV SIMUL iron shirt
translation: Paul is watching TV, he is ironing his shirts.
comment: ok with a modal

words: Susie là bác.sĩ, cô.ấy nghèo
glosses: Susie COP doctor, 3SG poor
translation: Susie is a doctor but she is poor.
comment: would prefer a connective

words: Jen mua kem, cô.ấy lại mua cho một người.lạ
glosses: Jen buy ice.cream, 3SG PRT buy PREP INDEF stranger
translation: Jen bought ice cream, but she bought it for a stranger.
comment: This is odd without a connector

words: Paul không phải là bác.sĩ, anh.ấy là nhân.viên lễ.tân
glosses: Paul NEG true COP doctor, 3SG COP worker reception
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.
comment: That’s fine, but the pronoun (anh.ấy) is obligatory if no connector is there

words: Jen không mua kem, cô.ấy mua sô-cô-la.
glosses: Jen NEG buy ice.cream, 3SG buy chocolate.
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream but she bought chocolate.
comment: not too bad (if the pronoun is there)

words: Susie là bác.sĩ mà là giáo.viên.
glosses: Susie COP doctor but COP teacher.
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.

words: Susie là bác.sĩ mà cô.ấy nghèo
glosses: Susie COP doctor but 3SG poor
translation: Susie is a doctor but she is poor.
comment: that’s good

words: Paul là bác.sĩ mà John là bác.sĩ
glosses: Paul COP doctor but John COP doctor
translation: Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.

words: John có.thể là bác.sĩ mà nhà.văn.
glosses: John EXIS.ABIL COP doctor but writer.
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer.

words: John là bác.sĩ mà John là nhà.văn
glosses: John COP doctor but John COP writer
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer (maybe both).

words: Paul không phải là bác.sĩ mà không phải y.tá.
glosses: Paul NEG true COP doctor but NEG true nurse.
translation: Paul is neither a doctor nor is he a nurse.

words: Paul không phải là bác.sĩ mà y.tá.
glosses: Paul NEG true COP doctor but nurse.
translation: Paul is neither a doctor nor is he a nurse.

words: Paul là bác.sĩ mà y.tá.
glosses: Paul COP doctor but nurse.
translation: Paul is neither a doctor nor is he a nurse.

words: Paul là bác.sĩ, John là bác.sĩ
glosses: Paul COP doctor, John COP doctor
translation: Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.

words: Hoặc Paul là bác.sĩ hoặc John là bác.sĩ
glosses: Or Paul COP doctor or John COP doctor
translation: Paul and John are both doctors.

words: Paul là bác.sĩ hay John là bác.sĩ
glosses: Paul COP doctor or John COP doctor
translation: Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.
comment: would add something like “I don’t know…”, would be sth. like a rhetorical question

full_form: có thể … hoặc cũng … có thể
words: Paul có thể là bác.sĩ hoặc cũng có thể John là bác.sĩ
glosses: Paul EXIS ABIL COP doctor or also EXIS ABIL John COP doctor
translation: Paul and John are both doctors.
comment: This seems ok

words: Bạn để điện.thoại ở chỗ làm hoặc bạn để trên xe buýt?
glosses: You leave phone PRP place work or you leave PRP CLF bus?
translation: Did you leave your phone at work or did you leave it on the bus?
comment: The last two are not questions

words: Hoặc bạn để điện.thoại ở chỗ làm hoặc bạn để trên xe buýt?
glosses: Or you leave phone PRP place work or you leave PRP CLF bus?
translation: Did you leave your phone at work or did you leave it on the bus?
comment: The last two are not questions

words: Paul không phải là bác.sĩ, không phải là y.tá.
glosses: Paul NEG true COP doctor, NEG true COP nurse.
translation: Paul is neither a doctor nor is he a nurse.
comment: not too bad

words: Paul có thể ăn bánh cupcake hoặc có thể ăn bánh quy
glosses: Paul EXIS ABIL eat CLF cupcake or EXIS ABIL eat CLF cookie
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or he can eat a cookie.
comment: Good

words: Paul có thể ăn bánh cupcake cũng có thể ăn bánh quy
glosses: Paul EXIS ABIL eat CLF cupcake also EXIS ABIL eat CLF cookie
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or he can eat a cookie.
comment: Good

words: Hoặc Paul có thể ăn bánh cupcake hoặc cũng có thể ăn bánh quy
glosses: Or Paul EXIS ABIL eat CLF cupcake or also EXIS ABIL eat CLF cookie
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or he can eat a cookie.
comment: Not really bad, just not quite as natural as the other ones

words: Hoặc Paul có thể ăn bánh cupcake hoặc có thể ăn bánh quy
glosses: Or Paul EXIS ABIL eat CLF cupcake or EXIS ABIL eat CLF cookie
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or he can eat a cookie.
comment: See above, not really bad, just not quite natural

words: Paul có thể ăn bánh cupcake hay có thể ăn bánh quy
glosses: Paul EXIS ABIL eat CLF cupcake or EXIS ABIL eat CLF cookie
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or he can eat a cookie.
comment: Again, these would need embedding and be interpreted as questions (“I don’t know… “)

words: Paul có thể ăn bánh cupcake hay cũng có thể ăn bánh quy
glosses: Paul EXIS ABIL eat CLF cupcake or also EXIS ABIL eat CLF cookie
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or he can eat a cookie.
comment: Again, these would need embedding and be interpreted as questions (“I don’t know… “)

words: Susie không phải là bác.sĩ hoặc vận.động.viên điền.kinh
glosses: Susie NEG true COP doctor or athlete track
translation: Susie isn’t a doctor or a runner.
